titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New-York and Brooklyn Steam Ferry Boat Company toll books 1977.030
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-09T13:19-0500

did.unittitle: New-York and Brooklyn Steam Ferry Boat Company toll books

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: New-York and Brooklyn Steam Ferry Boat Company.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); New-York and Brooklyn Steam Ferry Boat Company toll books, 1977.030, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The New-York and Brooklyn Steam Ferry Boat Company was established in 1814 Robert Fulton, developer of the first commercially successful steamboat. The Company operated the Nassau, the first steam ferry to connect Brooklyn and New York City.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains three toll books of the New-York and Brooklyn Steam Ferry Boat Company dating from 1825 to 1826, 1828 to 1829, and 1836 to 1837. The toll books record the weekly ferry toll received on the Brooklyn side, and list daily receipts signed by the ferry master upon turning in the weekly total.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Gift of John J. Pierrepont and Alden Spooner, date unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related archival collections at the Brooklyn Historical Society:

list.item: 1977.051, Catherine and Main Street Ferry Company records, 1812-1845
